With the loss of our New World holdings and consolidation of India, we have large deficits left to fill and yet we were unable to prevent the wealth we had left from spilling into Qing coffers. The growing demand for chinese goods in Europe has far outscaled any efforts to wrestle their monopoly away on tea and silk. However, the climate in India is suitable for poppy production, allowing us to exchange opium for tea at an unprecedented scale. Unfortunately, the Qing have begun to notice this activity and while undoubtedly clamp down on the trade.
After the Qing officials at the Canton port confiscated and destroyed a sizable reserve of opium, many demand compensation.
Get some China/Africa on your cock
China has always been one of the most powerful empires the world has ever seen. They are however weak and fragmented and failed to civilize properly.

Opium spread from a neighboring tile

The Barbarian Westerners seek to trick us by shipping the poisonous poppy into the mandate's borders. Our skilled trade minister has confiscated and burnt a large shipment of opium in an attempt to send a message to the British, although they now sit on a small island named Hong Kong until we reimburse them for the expense.

The barbarian outsiders have laid waste to our mighty armies, and ruined our once rich ports.

Despite the efforts of the Canton ministers and the emperor himself, the Qing were unable prevent free trade from spreading to the Heavenly Mandate. The peoples of Britain may now freely buy tea and silk as they wish.
